alert.note: Alert for San Joaquin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 9:48PM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... San Joaquin River Near Vernalis affecting San Joaquin County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Joaquin River near Vernalis. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 29.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM PDT Tuesday was 29.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 29.5 feet. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.8 feet on 03/18/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 1000 PM PDT.
